meanings.definition: Of or relating to the ecliptic.
meanings.sent1: The astronomer studied the ecliptics path of the planets.
meanings.sent2: The telescope was used to observe the ecliptics movement of the stars.
meanings.sent3: The classroom globe had a line showing the ecliptics route of the sun, making the students curious.
meanings.sent4: Her mind followed the ecliptics journey of thoughts, circling back to the same point.
meanings.sent5: The artist painted a vivid picture of the ecliptics pattern in the sky.

meanings.definition: A great circle on the celestial sphere representing the apparent annual path of the sun.
meanings.sent1: The diagram displayed the ecliptics route of the sun around the Earth.
meanings.sent2: Astronomers use the ecliptics to predict the positions of celestial bodies.
meanings.sent3: During the stargazing event, the children pretended to ride on the ecliptics like a magical carousel.
meanings.sent4: The ecliptics in the sky resembled a giant clock ticking through the seasons.
meanings.sent5: The ancient civilization built monuments aligned with the ecliptics for solstice celebrations.
